intro: Jasione amethystina subsp. mariana, commonly known as the Mariana violet, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, violet-blue flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in coastal or mountainous regions. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces capsules as its fruiting structure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
